text: hi my name is Bob Sutton and this is my
course I'm an organizational
psychologist So I've essentially devoted
my career to understanding the interplay
between leadership and how to make
workplaces better One of the things that
amazes me is at least 75% of the time
that one of my students becomes a
manager They don't get any training and
they often get no mentoring and no
coaching So I think it's important to
have some fundamental management courses
so they can learn the basics and have a
starting point Let's talk about what
we're going to cover in this course
First of all the mindset that the best
leaders are in tune with what it feels
like to work for them and they know to
look for the little signals that they're
pushing too hard or that they're not
pushing hard enough That ability to sort
of adjust one's assertiveness on the fly
is one of the most important things that
you will learn in this course and in
fact is the hallmark of great leaders I
think you have to have a good foundation
that can take time in order to go fast
We have the amazing Beth Steinberg who
has been the leader in HR roles from
Nordstrom to Nike to Electronic Arts to
Google So she has all sorts of
experience I have a a model that I use
around scaling that's culture structure
talent management systems and process We
talk about all her tips about how to
become a great leader how to avoid
becoming overly stressed as a leader
When you have earned some grace and
shown some grace it's still going to be
hard but you're going to get a lot
further So I hope that you have as much
fun taking this course as we at Stanford
did creating it
[Music]
